node.title: New extinct duck found in Central Otago
node.description: Researchers working together - from Canterbury Museum and three Australian universities - are excited at the impact of the discovery on understanding the region's natural history.

node.title: NZME profits up on back of 13% rise in advertising revenue
node.description: The media company NZME has posted a jump in profit as advertising recovered despite the challenges posed by Covid-19.

node.title: OCR rise could sting first home buyers, struggling businesses - expert
node.description: The Reserve Bank unveiled another 25 basis points increase in the OCR, and while it might have been the prudent thing to do, struggling businesses might be in for a cooling in consumer spending.

node.title: Serious crash shuts part of SH16 northbound lanes
node.description: A serious crash has shut a section of State Highway 16 near the Auckland suburb of Rosebank this afternoon.

node.title: Foreign Minister Nanaia Mahuta calls in Russian Ambassador over Ukraine crisis
node.description: Minister of Foreign Affairs Nanaia Mahuta has called in the Russian Ambassador to hear New Zealand's strong opposition to escalating Russian aggression towards Ukraine.

node.title: National MP Tim Van de Molen on leave with broken bones
node.description: National's MP for Waikato Tim Van de Molen will be on leave after he fell from a platform, breaking multiple bones.

node.title: Children at centre of Whanganui's Covid-19 outbreak
node.description: Covid-19 is spreading fastest among children and teens in the Whanganui and Rangitīkei Covid-19 outbreak as the region faces the second-lowest rate of child 5 to 11 vaccinations in the country.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 3297 new community cases in NZ today
node.description: Today there are 3297 new cases of Covid-19 in the community in New Zealand today, the Ministry of Health has confirmed.

node.title: Hydroslide designed on eel pot the latest addition to Christchurch build
node.description: The installation has begun for five new slides, which will be the biggest in the country, at Parakiore Recreation and Sport Centre.

node.title: PM: 'I choose not to focus on what is often a small handful of people'
node.description: After being verbally abused this afternoon, Jacinda Ardern says there have been people opposed to vaccinations ever since the campaign started.

node.title: Trump Org., ex-CFO Allen Weisselberg seek dismissal of criminal charges
node.description: In Tuesday's filings, they claimed they were "improperly targeted....based on political animus"

node.title: ‘It’s real, please take it seriously’ - Rotorua mayor tests positive for Covid-19
node.description: Steve Chadwick says the worst of the illness appears to be over but it hit her "very hard".

node.title: Biden has interviewed his top three Supreme Court candidates
node.description: He is expected to announce his nominee by the end of February.

node.title: Oklahoma U.S. House candidate apologizes after middle-school sleepover
node.description: Abby Broyles said she was sorry after reports she was intoxicated at weekend slumber party, berated some of the children and vomited in a hamper.

node.title: China's Covid-zero policy forces some NZ businesses to suspend exports
node.description: Despite the risk of catching the coronavirus from food being considered highly unlikely, as part of China's Covid-19 zero policy food producers who experience positive cases at their sites are…

node.title: GP suspended for anti-vax views begins District Court appeal
node.description: Two of the first doctors to be suspended for Covid-19 misinformation in New Zealand are appealing the Medical Council's decision in the Wellington District Court today.

node.title: 4 killed after helicopter crashes near Navy missile facility in Hawaii
node.description: The victims identities were not released.

node.title: NASA's new "NACHOS" instrument could help predict volcanic eruptions
node.description: NACHOS is a pint-sized powerhouse dedicated to observing trace gases that can be harbingers of volcanic activity.

node.title: Covid: England ending isolation laws and mass free testing
node.description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson has announced all Covid restrictions will end in England this week and free mass testing will stop from 1 April.

node.title: New strong wool industry body aims to grow sector's profits
node.description: New Zealand strong wool farmers, growers, manufacturers and exporters have joined forces to establish the industry group Wool Impact NZ.

node.title: Woman sues LAPD after she was wrongfully arrested and spent two weeks in jail
node.description: Police are accused of mistaking Bethany K. Farber for another suspect with the same name.

node.title: Tiwai Point smelter deal contributes to dip in Meridian's first-half profit
node.description: Meridian has reported a drop in first-half profit reflecting negative changes in the value of hedge instruments as well as a drop in revenue from Tiwai Point Aluminium Smelter.

node.title: 'Very confusing, very quickly': Luxon wants pathway beyond peak of Omicron
node.description: The government needs to front up on when vaccine mandates will be removed, the National Party leader says. Audio

node.title: Muslims remain at risk of being targeted by terrorists within NZ, coroner told
node.description: The Islamic Women's Council has told a coronial hearing into the Christchurch mosque attacks that Muslims are still in danger of being targeted by terrorists in New Zealand.

node.title: Rapid antigen tests adopted as main Covid-19 test for Aucklanders
node.description: Rapid Antigen Tests are being used as the primary test at Auckland community testing centres from today to help meet demand for testing as the Omicron outbreak grows.

node.title: 'We were gutted': Studies disrupted as Covid-19 spreads at universities
node.description: Lectures started at some universities this week and the Union of Students' Associations said there had been cases of the virus among students at several institutions.

node.title: PCR testing 'inundated', labs look ahead to phase three
node.description: Testing laboratories say they have been inundated with demand for Covid-19 PCR tests much faster than expected, and there's a major backlog in Auckland. Audio

node.title: Mobile revenue helps drive half-year profit rise for Spark
node.description: A lift in mobile revenue, lower depreciation costs and falling finance expenses have boosted Spark's bottom line.

node.title: National pushes for law to sanction Russia over Ukraine actions
node.description: The National Party wants a law change that will enable New Zealand to place sanctions on Russia outside of the United Nations' process.

node.title: Putin recognises Ukraine rebel regions as independent
